page.title: 05B'HAM INTERNATIONAL STATION
page.content: THE FIRST NEW STATION TO BE BUILT IN ENGLAND SINCE 1926.IT WAS OPENED IN SEPTEMBER 1976.IT WAS BUILT AS PART OF THE TRANSPORT SYSTEM FOR THE N.E.C AND BIRMINGHAM INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. THE STATION HAS 5 PLATFORMS EACH PLATFORM IS LONG ENOUGH TO TAKE 14 COACHES.20 STAFF ARE EMPLOYED BY BRITISH RAIL AS ANNOUNCERS,TICKET COLLECTORS,BOOKING OFFICE STAFF, PORTERS AND CLEANERS.THE STATION MASTER IS MR.STEVENS.SIGNALLING SYSTEMS,TRAIN ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE BOARDS AND STATION RUNNING IS COMPUTERIZED.510 TRAINS RUN FROM MONDAY TO FRIDAY,THERE ARE 15,00 REGULAR DAILY PASSENGERS MOSTLY COMMUTORS.AT PEAK N.E.C. SHOWTIMES UP TO 40,000 PASSENGERS A DAY USE THE STATION.THERE IS CAR PARKING SPACE FOR 830 CARS.IT TAKES 1.25 HRS. TO REACH LONDON EUSTON.10MINS TO B'HAM.
